abstract.t: This document defines a human readable ASPA notation for use with RPKI tooling. The desire is that this will help create consistency across various tools, and thus support the principle of least surprise to operators. That said, this definition is informational, and implementations can choose to use their own notation styles instead.

section.name: Requirements notation
section.t: The key words "MUST", "MUST NOT", "REQUIRED", "SHALL", "SHALL NOT", "SHOULD", "SHOULD NOT", "RECOMMENDED", "NOT RECOMMENDED", "MAY", and "OPTIONAL" in this document are to be interpreted as described in BCP 14 when, and only when, they appear in all capitals, as shown here.

section.name: ASPA Notation Definition
section.t: This specification uses ABNF syntax specified in .
section.artwork:
notation = customer-as separator provider-as-set
customer-as = asn separator = " => " provider-as-set = empty-list / provider-list
empty-list = "<none>" provider-list = provider-as *(provider-separator provider-as) provider-as = asn / asn-v4 /asn-v6 provider-separator = ", "
asn = 1*8DIGIT asn-v4 = asn "(v4)" asn-v6 = asn "(v6)"

section.name: customer-as
section.t: This field represents the customerASID defined in section 3.3 of

section.name: provider-as-set
section.t: This field represents the providerASSET defined in section 3.4 of . For the moment we assume that version -07 of this document will allow the use of an explicit empty provider AS set, rather than using AS0 for this purpose.

section.name: empty-list
section.t: If an ASPA has no providers this is explicitly specified by using the value "<none>".

section.name: provider-list
section.t: If an ASPA has at least one provider then we need to specify them. I.e. we need to mention the first provider-as and, if applicable, all following provider-as values separated by a comma and space character. Note that provider-as values MUST be sorted by their asn value.

section.name: provider-as
section.t: A provider-as can be an 'asn', 'asn-v4' or 'asn-v6'. Note that the latter two options include an 'asn', but limit the scope of the provider to an address family, IPv4 and IPv6 respectively. A specification MUST NOT contain more than one provider-as for the same 'asn' - e.g. a provider cannot be defined without address family limit AND with such a limit.

section.name: asn
section.t: This represents the decimal value of a 32 bit Autonomous System Number. Values MUST be part of the range 0-4294967295.

section.name: asn-v4
section.t: This represents a provider ASN which is authorised for IPv4 only.

section.name: asn-v6
section.t: This represents a provider ASN which is authorised for IPv6 only.

section.name: IANA Considerations
section.t: This document has no IANA actions.
